subject_terms_3: Indian sculpture/ sculpture Religion and Philosophy
physical_appearance: "This is a sculpture that has arms, legs, ears, and a head that ends with a finial. Figurative, its eyes are implied by the two hooks. Its legs are adorned with bangles, and its left ear has a lone blue bead dangling from the mounted ring. Though stiff and a bit flat, it has an empty ""body"" and thus only has its frame decorated. "
sgcool_label_text: A frame, with arms and legs, and the head suggested by a pointed finial. Either side are pierced ears, one adorned with an earring. It wears bracelets and large anklets. The hooks at the top of the frame are to hang a symbol representative of the deity. The frame denotes the formless transcendence of the goddess.
title_text: The Supreme Goddess as a void
subject_terms_2: Religious articles  Copperwork  Sunyata  Figurative art Goddesses
